questions: What is the Council of OUSL?
Who governs the the Open University of Sri Lanka?
What is the highest governing body?
What is the main governing body of OUSL?
Who takes key decisions at OUSL?
What is the supreme authority of the university?
What does the OUSL Council do?
What are the duties of the Council?
Who is responsible for administration and finance at OUSL?
Who sets the strategic direction for the Open University?
Who oversees the overall management of OUSL?
Who are the members of the OUSL Council?
Who sits on the Council?
Is the Vice-Chancellor part of the Council?
Are Deans members of the Council?
Who appoints members to the OUSL Council?
Are there external members in the Council?
What role does the University Grants Commission (UGC) play in the Council?
Who makes the big decisions at OUSL?
Who decides on the university's policies and finances?
Who is the top decision-making body at the Open University?
What group runs the administration of OUSL?
How is OUSL governed?
Who is the highest authority in the university?
Who plans the strategic direction of OUSL?
answer: The Council is the supreme governing authority of the OUSL. It is responsible for the overall administration, finance, and strategic direction of the University. It consists of internal members like the Vice-Chancellor and Deans, as well as external members appointed by the University Grants Commission.

questions: What is the Senate of OUSL?
What does the Senate do?
Who manages academic matters?
What is the academic authority of OUSL?
What is the highest academic body of the Open University of Sri Lanka?
Who oversees academic matters at OUSL?
Who regulates academic standards at OUSL?
What body handles academics at the university?
What are the duties of the Senate?
Who is responsible for curriculum development at OUSL?
Who oversees examinations and student admissions at OUSL?
Who manages research and academic standards?
Who decides on academic regulations at the Open University?
Who chairs the Senate at OUSL?
Is the Vice-Chancellor part of the Senate?
Who leads the academic decision-making body?
Who makes final decisions on academic policies at OUSL?
Which body handles research and exams at OUSL?
Who manages academic rules and standards?
What group is responsible for student admissions and curriculum?
Who governs academics at the Open University?
Who ensures quality in teaching and learning at OUSL?
answer: The Senate is the highest academic body of the University and is responsible for the regulation and maintenance of academic standards. It oversees matters such as curriculum development, examinations, research, and student admissions. It is chaired by the Vice-Chancellor.

questions: What is a Faculty Board?

Who runs the faculties at OUSL?
Who approves courses and exams for each faculty?
What group handles academic and student issues at the faculty level?
How are academic decisions made in each faculty?
Who manages the day-to-day academic governance within a faculty?
answer: Each Faculty has its own Faculty Board, chaired by the respective Dean. These boards manage academic and administrative affairs at the faculty level, including course approvals, examination matters, and student affairs.

questions: What are Senate Committees?

answer: Senate Committees are subcommittees under the Senate formed for specific academic functions such as curriculum, research, examinations, and quality assurance. They support academic planning, policy implementation, and monitoring.

questions: What is the administrative structure of OUSL?
How is the university managed?
Who assists the VC?
Who are the main officers running OUSL?

How is OUSL administratively organized?
Who are the officials involved in decision-making at OUSL?
Who supports the functioning of OUSL?

Who manages the university along with the Vice-Chancellor?
How does OUSL's administration work?
What officers are in charge of supporting the university's functions?
answer: The administrative structure of OUSL includes the Vice-Chancellor, Deans, Registrar, Bursar, Librarian, Heads of Departments, and Directors of Centers. These officers support the functioning and decision-making process of the university as per the Universities Act and internal regulations.

questions: What does a Head of Department do?

answer: Heads of Departments (HoDs) are responsible for the academic and administrative management of their respective departments. They oversee teaching, research, examinations, and resource allocation at the departmental level.

answer: The Senate Research Committee (SRC) evaluates and recommends approval of research proposals, guides research policy, and ensures ethical practices in university research.

answer: OUSL has several institutional committees such as the IQAC, Finance Committee, Audit Committee, and Library Committee, which support governance and operational excellence in specific functional areas.

answer: Statutory bodies at OUSL include the Council and the Senate. These are established by law under the Universities Act and form the foundation for decision-making and governance within the institution.
